# SwiftFlow 1.0.0 - Initial Release ğŸš€

A modern, declarative node-based editor framework for SwiftUI. Build interactive flowcharts, diagrams, and visual editors for macOS.

## âœ¨ Highlights

- **Declarative SwiftUI API** â€” Native integration with the Apple ecosystem
- **Zero Dependencies** â€” Lightweight and production-ready
- **Three-Space Coordinate System** â€” Eliminates common positioning bugs
- **Command Pattern** â€” Professional undo/redo support
- **Interactive Components** â€” MiniMap, helper lines, snap-to-grid, and more
- **Comprehensive Documentation** â€” Swift-DocC with complete API reference

## ğŸ“¦ Installation

Add to your `Package.swift`:

```swift
dependencies: [
    .package(url: "https://github.com/jeffryberdugox/SwiftFlow.git", from: "1.0.0")
]
```

## ğŸ¯ Core Features

### Node System
- Interactive dragging with snap-to-grid
- Multi-node selection
- Parent-child relationships
- Customizable content via SwiftUI

### Edge System
- Multiple styles: Bezier, SmoothStep, Straight
- Edge markers and labels
- Animated edges
- Custom styling

### Interaction
- Pan & Zoom with configurable limits
- Box selection
- Keyboard shortcuts (copy, paste, undo, redo)
- Helper lines with snap-to-align
- Connection creation via drag-and-drop

### Visual Components
- **MiniMap** â€” Interactive bird's-eye view
- **Grid Background** â€” Dots or lines pattern
- **Node Toolbar** â€” Contextual actions
- **Controls** â€” Zoom and fit-view buttons
